Polymers.name: Degree of Polymerization
Polymers.description: The degree of polymerization (DP) is the average number of repeating units in a polymer chain.

variables.M_n: Number-average molecular weight of the polymer (g/mol)
variables.M_0: Molecular weight of the repeating unit (g/mol)

Polymers.name: Number-Average Molecular Weight
Polymers.description: Calculates the number-average molecular weight of a polymer sample from the number of molecules in each fraction and their corresponding molecular weights.

variables.N_i: Number of molecules of type i

Polymers.name: Weight-Average Molecular Weight
Polymers.description: Calculates the weight-average molecular weight of a polymer sample using the weight fraction of each component.

Polymers.name: Polydispersity Index
Polymers.description: Indicates the breadth of the molecular weight distribution of a polymer sample. A value of 1 means all chains are the same length (monodisperse).

Polymers.name: Molecular Weight of a polymer(MW)
Polymers.description: Molecular weight of a polymer

Polymers.name: Rate of Initiation
Polymers.description: The rate at which free radicals are generated from the initiator in a chain-growth polymerization.

variables.f: Initiator efficiency (fraction of radicals that actually start chains)

Polymers.name: Rate of Propagation
Polymers.description: The rate at which monomer molecules add to the growing polymer chain.

Polymers.name: Rate of Termination (by Combination)
Polymers.description: The rate at which active polymer radicals terminate by combination or disproportionation.

Polymers.name: Steady-State Radical Concentration
Polymers.description: Under steady-state conditions, the concentration of radicals is determined by the balance of initiation and termination.

Polymers.name: Overall Rate of Polymerization
Polymers.description: Combines propagation and steady-state radical concentration to give the overall rate of polymerization.

Polymers.name: Degree of Polymerization (Kinetic)
Polymers.description: Average number of monomer units added per growing chain under steady-state conditions.

Polymers.name: Shear Stress in Flow Channel
Polymers.description: Relates the shear stress at the wall of a cylindrical die or tube to the pressure drop during polymer melt flow.

variables.\\Delta P: Pressure drop across the length L of the channel (Pa)

Polymers.name: Shear Rate in Capillary
Polymers.description: Apparent shear rate in a capillary rheometer used to characterise polymer melts.

Polymers.name: Apparent Viscosity
Polymers.description: The apparent (or effective) viscosity of a polymer melt under specified shear conditions.

Polymers.name: Power-Law Model for Non-Newtonian Melt
Polymers.description: Empirical power-law expression describing non-Newtonian behaviour of polymer melts.

variables.n: Flow behaviour index (dimensionless; n<1 for shear-thinning)

Polymers.name: Draw Ratio (Fiber Spinning)
Polymers.description: Indicates how much the fiber is stretched during spinning or film drawing.

variables.V_{\\text{extrusion}}: Extrusion velocity at the die exit (m/s)

Polymers.name: Melt Flow Index (Conceptual)
Polymers.description: Mass of polymer melt (m) extruded in time t under standard load; widely used to compare processability of thermoplastics.

Polymers.name: Tensile Stress
Polymers.description: Stress in a polymer specimen under tensile load.

Polymers.name: Tensile Strain
Polymers.description: Engineering strain in a polymer specimen under tensile load.

Polymers.name: Hooke's Law (Elastic Region)
Polymers.description: Relationship between stress and strain in the linear-elastic region of a polymer sample.

Polymers.name: Shear Stress
Polymers.description: Relationship between shear stress and shear strain for a polymer sample in the elastic region.

Polymers.name: Poisson's Ratio
Polymers.description: Ratio of lateral contraction strain to axial extension strain in a stretched polymer.

Polymers.name: Creep Compliance
Polymers.description: Time-dependent compliance of a polymer under a constant stress (creep behaviour).

Polymers.name: Stress Relaxation Modulus
Polymers.description: Time-dependent relaxation modulus of a polymer held at constant strain.

Polymers.name: True Stress
Polymers.description: Conversion from engineering stress to true stress in a polymer specimen undergoing tensile deformation.

Polymers.name: Newtonian Viscosity
Polymers.description: Shear stress–shear rate relationship for a Newtonian polymer melt.

Polymers.name: Power Law Model (Non-Newtonian)
Polymers.description: Generalised model for shear stress in non-Newtonian (pseudoplastic or dilatant) polymer melts.

Polymers.name: Apparent Viscosity (Power Law Fluid)
Polymers.description: Effective viscosity of a non-Newtonian polymer melt at a given shear rate.

Polymers.name: Maxwell Model (Stress Relaxation)
Polymers.description: Stress relaxation in a Maxwell viscoelastic element under constant strain.

Polymers.name: Maxwell Model (Constitutive Equation)
Polymers.description: Differential form of Maxwell model relating stress and strain rate.

Polymers.name: Kelvin-Voigt Model (Creep)
Polymers.description: Time-dependent strain (creep) in a Kelvin-Voigt viscoelastic element under constant stress.

Polymers.name: Storage and Loss Moduli (Oscillatory Rheology)
Polymers.formula: G'(\omega) = \omega \int_{0}^{\infty} G(t) \sin(\omega t) dt \\ , \\ G''(\omega) = \omega \int_{0}^{\infty} G(t) \cos(\omega t) dt
Polymers.description: Expressions for the storage modulus (elastic response) and loss modulus (viscous response) in dynamic mechanical analysis.

variables.G(t): Relaxation modulus as a function of time (Pa)

Polymers.name: Complex Viscosity
Polymers.description: Magnitude of the complex viscosity from oscillatory measurements.
